title: Dev Toolbox
summary: A developer environment and internal tools platform built around clarity, structure, and explainability.
problem: Developers often lack structured tools that surface context, reduce cognitive load, and support explainable workflows.
context: Created as a solo project to explore better ways of organizing development work, surfacing context, and supporting reasoning.
solution: Designed and built a modular internal tooling environment that makes project context, workflows, and changes more visible and easier to reason about.
impact: Improved structure and visibility during development, making it easier to understand what’s happening in the system and why.

title: Operations & Workflow Design
summary: Improving team clarity and execution by shaping workflows, expectations, and feedback loops in operational roles.
problem: Teams were working in high-variance environments with unclear expectations, unstable processes, and communication gaps that made day-to-day execution harder than it needed to be.
context: In operational and leadership roles, I was responsible not just for outcomes, but for how people moved through their work — how information flowed, how handoffs worked, and how changes were communicated.
solution: Clarified expectations, designed and refined workflows, and coached people through transitions, focusing on making responsibilities visible and reducing friction in handoffs.
impact: Improved alignment, fewer surprises, and more stable day-to-day operations, with teams having clearer expectations and a more predictable way of working.

title: Finance Tools / Simplicity
summary: A budgeting and financial-tracking system designed for calm visibility into day-to-day money decisions.
problem: Personal budgeting tools often create noise instead of clarity, making it harder for people to understand where their money is going.
context: Built as a practical system to support real-world budgeting and monthly planning, with an emphasis on calm, reliable visibility.
solution: Created a budgeting and occurrence-tracking flow that highlights what matters each month, keeps categories honest, and reduces friction in daily use.
impact: Supports more confident financial decisions by making obligations, patterns, and tradeoffs easier to see at a glance.

title: Aurora
summary: A conceptual approach to building software through conversation, centered on intent, understanding, and transparent results.
problem: Software creation today is fragmented across tools, documents, and communication channels, making it hard to maintain clarity and shared understanding.
context: Emerging from years of operational work and independent software development, focused on clarity, explanation, and how people naturally express intent.
solution: Explores a conversational workflow for software: people express intent, the system reflects its understanding, and results evolve through shared reasoning.
impact: Provides a direction for future tools and platforms that prioritize clarity, explainability, and human-centered interaction with complex systems.
